page.description: Summary values display various types of information about a field as it appears throughout the entire table.

section.description: Summary values display various types of information about a field as it appears throughout the entire table. In other words these calculations summarize all values on all pages of the grid, not just values displayed on the visible page. Summary types include: Total (numeric fields only), Count (numeric fields only), Average (numeric fields only), Minimum, Maximum, Standard Deviation (numeric fields only), Variance (numeric fields only), First, and Last. You can have summaries of as many columns as you want. Summaries can appear on all pages or on the last page only.

section.title: Total
section.description: Displays the total value of the fields in all the records of the table.

section.title: Count
section.description: Displays the count of the fields in all the records of the table.

section.title: Average
section.description: Displays the average value of the fields in all the records of the table.

section.title: Minimum
section.description: Displays the minimum value found in the field.

section.title: Maximum
section.description: Displays the maximum value found in the field.

section.title: Standard Deviation
section.description: Displays the standard deviation of the fields in all the records of the table.

section.title: Variance
section.description: Displays the variance of the fields in all the records of the table.

section.title: First
section.description: Displays the first value found in the field.

section.title: Last
section.description: Displays the last value found in the field.

section.title: Styling Summary Values
section.description: You can define inline styles for summary values. You can also use the BeforeSummarySectionRenderevent to make the inline style conditional on the value of the summary field.
